p: Vitamin D is a prohormone vitamin and is produced during exposure to sunlight, although smaller amounts are obtained from the food as well. It has many roles, including the enhancement of cellular immunity through the induction of antimicrobial peptides [ 81, 82]. SARS-CoV-2 infection can be lowered by targeting an unbalanced Renin-angiotensin system (RAS) with Vitamin D supplements [ 83]. The current pandemic of SARS-CoV-2 has led to a call for the widespread use of vitamin D supplements [ 83, 84, 85, 86].
